rComments: He is a pretty good professor. Yes, he is very good looking and young as if he were a student himself. Everything is well organized in his class. You may be confused if you have never taken any Architecture class before. Ask the TA for help. Take this class and don't be afraid to ask for clarification and help.

I was not expecting a hot teacher haha. He looks kind of like Hayden Christensen. Definitely a plus when going to class. He was a good teacher; explained the concepts well and was clear, but he wasn't stellar. Sometimes he got snappy with students, but there was one really annoying kid in the class, so it was kind of understandable

If you're interested in architecture and art history, if not you won't like it. He's passionate about his subject and if you actually ask him for help he's very helpful. The class itself can be difficult lots of readings and  essays but the final was very easy and there was no midterm. He's also really good looking, good motivation to attend class.

The lectures are intertwined so that the course acts fantastically as a whole.  The course is best suited to an ambitious philosopher or one with an inclination towards theoretical and abstract thinking.  That said, the final is surprisingly easy, and consists of learning by rote.  The potential for profundity is there, however.

This is one of my favorite classes I have taken, but that was probably because I love art history and architecture. Don't take it if you aren't willing to read the text book. I could see how it would have been very boring without my prior interest in the class. Braden is a hardass don't expect an easy time if you don't put in the work.

Had him for History of Modern Architecure and it's difficult without having any previous art history knowledge. He really knows his material but you have to have a genuine interest in order to do well. Also, lots of reading.

I loved this class. I recommend it only for students with an interest in architecture and art history. You must be willing to read the textbook extensively or otherwise you will be lost. His lectures are very helpful. Never miss a lecture!
